name: Les Sources de Caudalie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had lunch couple of days ago, very fresh ingredients with nice execution, relaxed atmosphere with efficient service, very nice wines to match with dishes. Enjoyed a three courses menu for 35euros. Will remember the cappuccino of panais...
reviews.title: Nice lunch, good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location of the hotel, although quite inconvenient to visit Bordeaux easily (about 30min far from the center), it is beautiful, located among the vineyards of the chateau, facing a beautiful pond hosting a couple of swans.
reviews.title: Nice for relaxing and gastronomic experience, poor spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are normal to spacious size, mine was on the first floor overlooking the pond and the vineyards. The bathroom was full of Caudalie cosmetics (a real joy - this brand has very good products!), and there was a bath tube. The room was supposed to have wifi, but... no! There was no reception of the wifi there, although from my room I could see the main building - it was not far at all. That was really inconvenient, sometimes there was no wifi not even in the reception and main building.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property with lackluster service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was one of the best ones I 've had in a 5 star hotel. A very nice selection of cheeses, home made croissants, quiche, fantastic apple pie, variety of breads, eggs made to order... All raw material used were really carefully chosen. I would say the same for the 2 restaurants: la table du lavoir offers a very nice ambiance and casual dining, the Grand Vigne is a Michelin star restaurant - well, I have to admit that food was nice but not exceptional to rate it with a michelin star! I cannot say about the prices, since it was not me who paid.
reviews.title: Chic but not exceptional!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Spa was below expectations unfortunately. It seems that it left without any renovation for a long time. The massage rooms are nothing special, there is no sauna (only a hamam), and the thermal bath is just adequate. There are no lockers but a wardrobe with a woman who keeps your staff, which is not very convenient having to leave your handbag and precious belongings there. Finally, the fitting rooms were just next to the place of the spa where you could sit and relax in between your therapies and watch the outdoors, and there was no door in between: that had as an effect that you could hear the hair dryer at times while you were enjoying your tea and the views... The massages were more like rubbing you...
reviews.title: Excellent experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights at Les Sources de Caudalie. We were efficiently and friendly checked in and shown to our very spacious room, with balcony, in the main house. The bathroom was large with a walk-in shower and a bath. Very nice. We ate the first night in La Grand Vigne which was excellent. Very good food, very good service and a cheese board to 'die' for. Breakfasts were served in this restaurant and well catered for. Our second dinner was in the Table du Lavoir. Because the fine dining room was closed for the evening everybody ate here and it was very full and noisy. A reminder that you were not the only tourist here! The food was good but certainly not to the standard of the previous night.
reviews.title: Serene

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Do venture out and take a walk in the woods - if you can find the path!!
reviews.title: Just Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful place and we would certainly recommend it but do go when La Grand Vigne is open.
reviews.title: peaceful place, but close to Bordeaux downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at this 5 star property as part of a wine tour. It was a great experience all round. The property itself is beautiful and the rooms, while rustic in decor, very comfortable and nicely appointed. Staff were quick to respond to a guest's request and were sincere in their desire to make sure your stay was enjoyable. We ate at the formal dining room, the more casual restaurant, and also enjoyed the breakfast buffet each morning. Surprisingly, the more formal meal was the least enjoyable, but that might have been due to our having been exhausted (it was the night we arrived) and some less intelligent choices from the menu. Certainly, a meal at the more casual country style restaurant was a hit and the breakfast buffet was plentiful and of a high standard.
reviews.title: Beautiful property in remote location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I'd note for work out buffs, that the gym on the property is rather lacking considering the calibre of the hotel. A small point perhaps, but it had the feel of being an afterthought. Still, the overall stay was completely enjoyable and I wouldn't hesistate to visit here again.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring vineyards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Great remote location with solid restaurants. Quiet and romantic.
reviews.title: Charming boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: a michelin starred restaurant.... luxurious wine spa... swans in an impeccable garden and palatial setting... one of the best chateaux in the world.... what more can you ask for? It's our annual home away from home. Above and beyond!
reviews.title: Luxury!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We just returned from a business awards trip, spending three nights at Les Sources de Caudalie. What a beautiful property! Charming and inviting, with something interesting to look at everywhere you turn! Our room was in one of the buildings away from the main building. The room was on the small side, but this is usual for Europe. The bed was wonderfully comfortable and the bathroom was large with a walk-in shower with products from the spa. Our room had wifi. Staff was helpful and unobtrusive. We spent our days touring vineyards, the city of Bordeaux and the village of St. Emilion, so we did not try out the spa-maybe next time! We did not have dinner at the restaurant, but we did enjoy late night drinks in the bar. It rained much of the time we were there, but that did not mar the beauty of the place. The chateau is not close to the city of Bordeaux, so a rental car or private car would be necessary. I would definitely return.
reviews.title: Peaceful and relaxing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at this beautiful property for 2 nights with work and would return for pleasure.
reviews.title: Amongst the vines

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room
reviews.title: Not great service given how much we spent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Excellent food, service, facilities and beautiful rooms and setting. This is a totally charming 5 star property which we loved and extended our stay as a result. The setting in the middle of vineyards is gorgeous, the breakfast an elegant treat, the spa unique and definitely worth a visit and the rooms nicely decorated with elegant provincial taste. Nice pool, lake with swans, 3 hole golf course free and unlimited for guests. Do the free tour ofnthe winery opposite. Treat yourself to Les Sources Caudalie - it's great value and a lovely, romantic spot.
reviews.title: Oustanding - a true find and a highlight of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used Sources as a base for a 3 day wine tour and enjoyed every moment of this beautiful small inn with world class service, food and ambiance. Had a nice massage after landing and had a chance to eat in the gourmet restaurant the first night (it was closed the other nights of our stay). While all the food itself was very good the cheese tray was the most impressive ever! The rest of the time we ate in the rustic cafe which was impressively beautiful in a country way, and while the menu was somewhat limited the food was very good. The room was attractive and comfortable with a beautiful view of the pond and swans. Even had a chance to knock off the rust and teach my wife a little billiards. Nothing but positives! Thank you Sources for making our stay a memorable one.
reviews.title: Beautiful relaxing spot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the resort last week with friends. The photo's on the web site do not do the rooms justice...we were in the basic level rooms. They are large and beautifully appointed. The bathrooms and bed are also oversized and luxurious.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel - Perfection in Bordeaux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Service and facility was excellent. Our wives used the spa services, we dined in both restaurants, used the desk to arrange chateaux tours through Decanter Tours (recommended by the hotel and they were also excellent). We had nothing but excellent experiences.
reviews.title: The place to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location allowed us to drive easily to St. Estephe and the Medoc wine route one day. Chez Hortense at Cap Ferret (a wonderful seaside restaurant), both about 45 minutes from the hotel. As well, there are many Chateaux within minutes of the hotel and Smith Haut Lafitte's vineyards are all around the hotel.
reviews.title: Just Superb

aka: Les Sources De Caudalie Hotel Martillac
description: Les Sources de Caudalie are located in the middle of Chateau Smith Haut Lafitte vineyards, only 15 minutes from Bordeaux center.The hotel also includes 2 restaurants and a Vinotherapie spa.
